809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:16): Hi, I'm brand new to this. I have a server set up through Apache and presently I have the Domain name I own simply linking to my IP. How do I get my purchased domain to be permanent and not just forward to my IP?
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:17): umm, what? isnt that how DNS works?
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:18): Well the IP is in the URL bar
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:18): Once you're forwarded
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:18): So if you type in www.mysite.com, you get forwarded to ip.ip.###
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:19): yeah, isn't that how dns works?
fc86d77d6e7f42af90b3ba3a7fb99be7 (09:19): megaspaz, http://torrent.fedoraunity.org .. that a little better?
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:19): www.nrbelex.com
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:19): watch what happens in the URL bar
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:19): i see you are using port 70
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:20): daMaestro: um... your fix was to get rid of the link ? :o
fc86d77d6e7f42af90b3ba3a7fb99be7 (09:20): added a new section
fc86d77d6e7f42af90b3ba3a7fb99be7 (09:20): How to Get Involved?
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:20): yeah, i just saw
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:20): I'm using port 70 cause my ISP blocks the usual port to make running a server more "fun"
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:20): Nrbelex: set your ServerName?
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:21): megaspaz, I guess - Is that what it looks like I need to do>
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:21): Nrbelex: how are you getting www.nrbelex.com to use port 70 by default?
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:21): other than that, i get a Access to this port disabled for security reasons...
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (09:21): Yeah, I don't care either
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:21): inMute, I edited a file in Apache
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:21): not what i meant
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:22): i meant how are you getting  www.nrbelex.com to resolve to an ip that uses port 70
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:22): generally DNS cant handle ports
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:22): Nrbelex: edit the same file or vhost config file and ... ServerName nrbelex.com ... ServerAlias www.nrbelex.com
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:22): imMute, I'm having the company I bought the domain name from forward people to it
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:22): could be doing an iptables route
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:23): ah, then thats probably your problem right ther
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:23): Haha, I told you I don't know what I'm doing - but help is appreciated
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:23): either have your isp unblock port 80 for you, or have the forwarders forward to your domain with the port added (instead of your ip)
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:24): tis a hard redirect, matey
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:24): have them do a proper dns entry
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:24): just babbling
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:24): Umm, I don't think my ISP wants me running a Server
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:24): so anything related to that option is out
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:25): and yet you're going to run one anyway...
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:25): I don't really do anything with it
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:25): I have an old computer lying around
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:26): They don't really care unless I post a music video which makes it big
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:26): Oh come on... don't tell me you've never heard of this before
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:26): i'm that's the exact wording in the contract you signed... :P
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:27): i cant wait till I go over my bandwidth one month and my ISP complains :)
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:28): where did you buy your domain name from?
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:28): GoDaddy
b0a90be919a9f920bb8ad2caca4e91f0 (09:28): GoDaddy is a very low price for domains, but a lot of people think they're pretty shady
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:29): i "bought" mine from dyndns :)
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:29): godaddy can do proper dns entries... why are you using forwarding/redirecting?
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:29): ... cause I don't know what I'm doing
e1a6f8fa11b9d9fa0f354c30f2743fc3 (09:29): megaspaz: to get around port 80 being bloced
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:29): And that too
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:29): you can use afraid.org or something to do port redirection
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:29): and do it properly
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:30): _Lewellyn knows how to do that port redirection crud
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:30): Nrbelex: you need to contact godaddy and ask them how to do a dns entry properly on their system
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:31): Ok, it's pretty much not a big issue - everything works - I just wanted the URL to say Nrbelex instead of the IP
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:31): I guess it's not really worth it
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:31): But thanks all
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:32): Nrbelex: it will if you do the dns for your domain name right
e839685e11b05b2d0b105dfcf634c034 (09:34): I have a problem with my apache running in Ubuntu
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:34): is that all you're going to tell us?

e839685e11b05b2d0b105dfcf634c034 (09:34): the problem is when I browse the .php
809e34715213d3b4dcc522babe5b44fd (09:35): Am I looking for a section on "Name Servers" through GoDaddy?
e839685e11b05b2d0b105dfcf634c034 (09:35): my phpinfo() see Japanese Support Enable
e839685e11b05b2d0b105dfcf634c034 (09:35): any suggest?

e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:36): Nrbelex: you should be using godaddy's nameservers... but if you also do afraid.org for port redirection, you'll want to use their name servers for you domain name... but you still need to set up your domain name correctly

e839685e11b05b2d0b105dfcf634c034 (09:36): megaspaz, I have a .php file with japanese encoding
e4d7ac934a5608807fe9130e93a22a50 (09:37): Nrbelex: the only time you need to deal with name servers is when you're setting up the dns for your domain name
